report.title: Emerging Trends in Electrical Power System Operation and Control Including High Penetration of Wind Power

topic.title: Emerging Trends in Electrical Power System Operation and Control Including High Penetration of Wind Power

report.title: EMERGING TRENDS IN POWER SYSTEM PLANNING & OPERATIONï¿½

description.text: <p>The Indian Power System, as well as in other countries, a High Penetration of Wind Power is considered desirable and attempted to circumvent the environmental pollution problem. The highly fluctuating Wind power &amp; its interaction with the slowly-responding Coal Fired Units are to be considered very carefully in the Optimized Power System Planning and Operation exercises undertaken.<br /><br />In this Lecture, the Main Features of the Evolving Smart EHV Transmission Networks and the Two Main Wind Power Generation Technologies, DFIG and PMSG, will first be briefly described.<br />Then, the way the Postgraduate Students and Research Scholars should adopt to study and pursue Research in the area of Optimal Power System Operation and Planning, including "Integrated Generation-Transmission Expansion Planning with High Penetration of Wind Power" will be suggested.</p>

topic.title: Emerging Trends in Power System Planning and Operation
